text: Bernie Sanders was the longest-serving independent in House history, from 1991 to 2007.
Polarization has increased with every House since 1977.
The south was traditionally a Democrat stronghold. They started losing ground there in the mid-1960s, until today the south is considered firmly Republican.
Since 1951, there have been only six independent representatives. None of them have had any formal party affiliation.
In 1933, the Fifth Party System began with Roosevelt's New Deal, an attempt to combat the depression.
The interwar period saw a sharp drop in political polarization, through both the roaring twenties and the great depression.
In the elections of 1896, the Third Party System gave way to the Fourth Party System.
